sect1.title: Working with worktrees
sect1.para: A worktree can be seen as an additional checkout of a Git repository (cf. ).

To create a new worktree, specify a folder. By default for the path the main repo path is selected. Modify that to your liking. For example from C:\Users\jdoe\TortoiseGit to C:\Users\jdoe\another-worktree.
To specify which revision is checked out, select HEAD, a branch, tag, or a concrete commit.
A branch can only be checked out at a single worktree. Alternatively use Force to check out the branch twice, but this is not recommended.
